meanings.definition: The edible pads of the prickly pear cactus.
meanings.sent1: I tried nopales for the first time at a Mexican restaurant.
meanings.sent2: In Mexico, nopales are commonly used in salads and tacos.
meanings.sent3: My friend thought nopales were alien food when she saw them on my plate.
meanings.sent4: The nopales looked like green pancakes stacked on top of each other.
meanings.sent5: The vendor at the market described the nopales as juicy and refreshing.

meanings.definition: A type of Mexican cuisine made with nopales.
meanings.sent1: I ordered a delicious dish with nopales and beans.
meanings.sent2: Nopales are often cooked with onions and tomatoes in traditional Mexican recipes.
meanings.sent3: The nopales dish was so tasty that I wanted to learn how to make it myself.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the nopales dish filled the kitchen with a delightful scent.
meanings.sent5: The chef recommended adding a squeeze of lime to enhance the flavor of the nopales.

meanings.definition: The plural form of nopal, referring to the cactus itself.
meanings.sent1: The desert landscape was dotted with nopales as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: Nopales are known for their resilience in harsh climates.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character lived in a house made entirely of nopales.
meanings.sent4: The nopales stood tall like guardians protecting the other plants.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful sunset behind a silhouette of nopales.
